The geographical location of the inciden: The expert analyzed the claim and pointed out that Missouri is a landlocked state far from any ocean, making it highly unlikely for a shark to be present in the floodwaters.
Physical characteristics of the flood: The expert observed that the floodwaters in the photograph were only thigh-high, suggesting a shallow depth. This contradicts the habitat requirements of ocean-going great white sharks.
Verification of the image: The expert mentioned that a larger version of the image showed that the entire road was not flooded, indicating that the photograph had been manipulated or misrepresented.
Historical context and previous circulat: The expert highlighted that the image had been circulating online since at least 2000, attached to floodwaters in various locations such as Ireland, Houston, England, and New Orleans. This indicated a pattern of the image being falsely associated with different incidents.
